stories.text:
Hi, I am the founder of a blog/e-commerce store and I am looking to scale my efforts with a very limit budget - $2000-$3000 roughly.

It's in the preparedness niche - a high-paying niche me and a friend are personally invested in. I receive anywhere from 15,000 to 30,000 visitors a month - it's somewhat seasonal. My social media following is around 20,000 - most on Facebook.

I am outsourcing/delegating some of the non-executive work and we are using a couple of paid tools, PPC/Facebook ads, along with hosting.

Our income streams are diverse - we receive a monthly paycheck from Ezoic and Amazon Affiliates. We also just started sponsored posts and backlink sales. Additionally, we just started drop shipping and we're getting some on and off results from there.

If you were in my shoes, what steps would you take to scale it on a major scale?
stories.title: Scale a medium-sized blog/e-commerce?
